Developer Student Circle
VIT Vellore
About Us

Google Developer Group, VIT Vellore is a non-profit developers group to learn, share and know more about Google technologies. Our events are open to newbies, developers, managers and organizations who are interested in Google\'s technologies or use them as part of their projects.
Tech Talks
Google talks are a grassroots-style series of presentation given by various technical experts spanning a wide spectrum of topics in technology and related areas.
DevFests
DevFests are large scale , community run events that offer speaker sessions across multiple product areas , hackathons , codelabs and much more.
Code School
Google code school teaches web technologies in the comfort of your browser through video lessons , coding challenges and screencasts.
Beta Testing
Beta Testing is the essence of developing a software. We test every aspect of our product before releasing it for the real-world exposure.
The Hackathon
What is the format of the hack?

The hack is scheduled to be a month long. During this month participants will have to submit their ideas and work on them. Selected teams will get a chance to pitch their ideas to judges on the final day.
What is the prize money?

The cash prize for the winners is INR 50K, INR 30K, and INR 20K for the first, second and third placed teams respectively along with loads of schwags. There are also prizes for .tech Domain Challenge, Hasura Open Source Challenge, and the Zulip Bot Building Challenge.
When is the event?
The event will be held on the 7th of October where only the pitching session for all the finalists will take place.
What is the venue for the event?
The venue for the event is Anna Auditorium, VIT University, Vellore.
What is the eligibility criteria?
Anyone can register for the hack, as the month progresses eliminations will be made based on the ideas submitted.
What is the timeline for the event?
Refer from the timeline section.
What is the evaluation criteria for my project?
Round 1: Judged on the basis of novelty and feasibility of ideas; Round 2: Judged on the basis of implementation of the idea Round; 3: Decided upon by the judges, after the final pitch
Are there any rules and regulations I am supposed to follow?
Participants are required to follow the guidelines mentioned on the Gravitas website.
How much time will my team get to pitch our idea on the final day?
Each team will get about 3\-5 mins of pitching time.
What do I need to bring to the event?
The participants are expected to carry their laptops and chargers, and their A-game pitching skills to the event.
What is the min and max team size?
There is no minimum team size. Teams up to 4 members will be allowed.
What are problem statements and by when will we get them?
Problem statements will be conveyed to the participants by email. You can refer to the statements at devfest2018.hackerearth.com as well.
What about food?
Meals and other refreshments like coffee will be provided to the participants.
What do I need for the final pitch?
Participants will be required to present a prototype of a fully working project to the judges.
What if I need some help during the event?
If you need any assistance you can write to us at dscvitvellore@gmail.com or approach any of our coordinators present during the event. All the best, and happy hacking!
DevTalks
What is DevTalks?

DevTalks is a tech convention which will have speakers delivering keynote sessions and engaging in panel discussions centered around the theme of “Disruptive Technologies”. It will also comprise of a networking session at the end for the finalists of the hackathon.
What is the venue for the event?
The venue for the event is Anna Auditorium, VIT University, Vellore.
When is the event taking place?
The event will take place on the 6th of October.
What is the event timeline?
Refer from the previous section
What is the registration procedure?

You can register for the event on the Gravitas portal. Due to limited seats, we would be waitlisting you. You will receive a registration form, based on which you will be sent an invite confirming your participation in the convention.
What is the networking session?
The networking session would be a closed session where the participants get a chance to have one-on-one interactions with the speaker panel and the judges of the hackathon.
When will the networking session take place?
The networking session will take place immediately after the convention is over.
What is the eligibility for the session?
Hackathon finalists and active participants selected during the convention will be eligible for the networking session.
What’s the registration fee?
You would be charged a fee of INR 5 to verify your registration on the Gravitas portal. All proceeds from the registration will be donated to a local NGO.
How do I get to the event?
Vellore is accessible by road as well as trains from Chennai and Bangalore.
Will I be reimbursed for my travel and accommodation?
Due to the nature and scale of the event, we would not be reimbursing the charges for travel and accommodation for the participants.
